titleStmt.title: Joseph Watson Beach to to Samuel L. Clemens : an electronic text

p.bibl: The Mark Twain Papers, The Bancroft Library, University of California, Berkeley (CU-MARK).

body.head: Joseph Watson Beach to Samuel L. Clemens 1 April 1884 • Hartford, Conn. (MS: CU-MARK, UCLC 41986)

opener.salute:
S. L. Clemens Esqr
Dear Sir

div1.p: If not presumption on my part may I ask you for your autograph for a very sweet young lady friend who is anxious to add to her collection the autographs of all of the leading authors of the day.Beach may refer to his daughter, Josephine Beach (born 1880), whom the Clemenses knew well enough that Olivia mentioned her presence at a performance of Dion Boucicault's The Colleen Bawn in a letter to SLC the following year: "that obnoxious Miss Beach (Mr Watson Beacheâ€™s daughter) sat directly behind us, and made very audible adverse criticisms" (Olivia Clemens to SLC, 25 January 1885, MS in CU-MARK). Say something sweet, do, she will appreciate it
